page.title: 06MEDICAL CARE IN HAWICK
page.content: Hawick has a Cottage Hospital with thirty beds. It caters mainly for minor emergencies, long-stay patients and the elderly. The nearest hospital for serious emergencies is Peel, half an hour's drive away. Many patients are sent for specialist treatment to Edinburgh, 55 miles away, where nearly two thirds of all maternity confinements take place. The town with its population of 17,500 is served by ten full-time doctors working from three practices. Specialists travel regularly to hawick for diagnostic consultations. The most usual point of contact is the traditional five to ten minute doctor- patient consultation. As yet computerization has not greatly affected local doctors although they anticipate that it will increasingly do so. .
